metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5723 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An attacker with temporary script access to a site could have set a cookiecontaining invalid characters using `document.cookie` that could have ledto unknown errors. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 119.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 119.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 119.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 119.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '119.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
